paper_abstract: The material point method (MPM) developed by Sulsky and colleagues is Currently being used to solve many challenging problems involving large deformation and/or fragementations with some Success. In order to understand the properties of this method, ail analysis of the considerable computational properties of MPM is undertaken in the context of model problems from gas dynamics. The MPM method in the form used here is shown both theoretically and computationally to have first-order accuracy for a standard gas dynamics test problem. Copyright (C) 2009 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
paper_title: Solving time-dependent PDEs using the material point method, a case study from gas dynamics
